feedback.Physical object: Included — A sandbag is a tangible, discrete object with physical boundaries.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — It is artificially constructed by humans; neither the sack nor the complete object exists naturally.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — It is neither living nor mimetic of biological systems.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Its use and identity rely on being stationary and heavy.
feedback.Structural: Excluded — It is not a load-bearing or framework-defining component.
feedback.Perceptible: Excluded — Visibility or detectability is not part of its intrinsic function.
feedback.Material form: Included — It consists of matter (e.g. sand and sack) and has solid, tangible form.
feedback.Passive: Included — It serves a passive role in resisting forces (e.g. impact, water) without transformation or output.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — It has no goal-directed function on its own.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — It does not emit signals or energy.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — No processing or regulation capability.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — Its state does not change autonomously or functionally.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — It is handled but not interactive in any operational sense.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Used within systems but not inherently part of one.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — It has no self-regulating or self-acting behavior.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — It is not a core dependency in most systems.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — It does not represent anything conceptually or symbolically by design.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Not governed by logic structures.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Not composed of nested or structured modules.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — It does not suggest or constrain behaviors inherently.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Identity is not abstractly shifted by context.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Its meaning is not defined socially or symbolically.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — It is not assigned a role by institutional systems.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — It does not define any identity or affiliation.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Not subject to formal rules or protocols by design.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — It is not a conceptual or procedural knowledge unit.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — Visibility is not functionally or socially defining.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Its meaning does not change intrinsically across contexts.
feedback.Widely known: Excluded — Recognition does not define its core identity.

encoding_notes: This encoding reflects a standard sandbag as a physical object with no symbolic or functional abstraction. Traits included are intrinsic to its identity as a fabricated, heavy, passive object used to resist force or movement.
